CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 12, 1952, pg. 34 reads: "New Electives Take Office - Two of the most controversial candidates but winners in the Nov. 6 elections attracted enormous crowds to the court house on Jan. 4 and 7. District Attorney James F. Malone Jr. took the oath of office Jan. 4 and State Senator John M. Walker was sworn in Jan. 7 as a minority member of the Board of County Commissioners.  Both are Republicans... Commissioners John J. Kane and John M. Walker were snapped (center) as the board settles down to organization and business for the day.  Commissioner Fowler was on the extreme end of the platform and is not shown...Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Commissioners John J. Kane and John M. Walker seated behind bench in Allegheny County Courthouse for swearing in ceremony
